page.title: 18Health Concerns
page.content: In the rural areas of South Northants. health problems are exacerbated by the lack of transport. Doctors have centralised their surgeries in health centres built in the towns & larger villages. Patients are required to attend the surgery for all but the very severe illnesses. Byfield, Towcester or Brackley are more than 5 miles away for medical attention & the collection of prescriptions. Brackley Cottage Hospital used to be the casualty unit & general hospital for the area. It is one of the few remaining small hospitals but its future is uncertain due to restraints on finance. This is causing great concern locally, people prefering personal & friendly service. However hospitals at Banbury or Northampton are used increasingly, especially for more complicated medication.
